data.actual_result: Each time a new message is sent until the server's hour also rolls around, a message break appears, then disappears
data.expected_result: The server just inserts the message break when *it* thinks it's time, since this would just lead to one delayed message break sometimes on the hour
data.short_description: When the next hour has started in client time but not yet in server time, message breaks between a single user's messages repeatedly appear and disappear
data.steps_to_repro: - Set PC clock 1 minute ahead - Find a channel where no one else is talking (might interrupt test) - Send a message right before the hour rolls over - Send messages after
